I could see this working well in athletic environments if you don't overspray, it's decidedly clean. Of course, nothing is inoffensive entirely (someone out there is bound to get annoyed...that's just how people are lately), but since the woods are quite light, I think you could wear it to the gym or in the height of summer.

In fact, despite the red packaging and the heavy cedar profile, I think this would actually be better in hot weather. Maybe it would develop into something more interesting?

I tend to really like Montblanc things for Men, but this one is underwhelming.

Safe blood orange and cedarwood mix. Much more artificial than other MB perfumes and the worst version of legend in my opinion. Go with other perfumes if you do not have a fetish for blood orange.

And, this DOES NOT smells like Kalan. Anyone who says this smells like Kalan are just trolls.
It’s good and blood orange isn’t something I smell a lot so that’s cool but it’s very forgetful and just overshadowed by so many other great scents, that just do it a lot better. Save your money

I really wanted to like this one, but it's just a big nothingburger. It doesn't scream unique and really doesn't change much from when you first put it on. Not to mention it's longevity and sillage is poor.

Legend Red in 2025: On my list of scents I sold.

Simply put, this is a cedar citrus scent with mediocre longevity. The blood orange note is nice and provides that spice to the citrus notes, however I feel there are much better alternatives out there.

If you are on a strict budget, you can probably find a small bottle on FB Marketplace for $20.

3/5 stars. At first I loved it upon a spray at Macys. After being gifted it, it does not last. 2-3 hours and then a skin scent for maybe 4 hours. Did not get compliments or mentions after 5-8! Sprays and going to work. Would
Not buy it again. Mediocre. Smells of both citrus and a cedar smell at once but won’t last.
Pretty basic and forgettable but a nice scent nonetheless. Soapy and spicy with a bit of wood. Performance is ok

Let me tell you something! If you’re about to blind buy any fragrance, ALWAYS check in on here first and read the comments! People know what are they talking about!
I literally just blind bought this despite reading the reviews prior. What would i say , everyone here were right! Why i still bought it?
A.the price (36 bucks for 3.3oz6
B. It is relatively new
C. It’s an E.D.P
And now for the smell …. Red warm fresh and very inoffensive. Sadly for an E.D.P the performance is very weak , subtle projection and longevity . For something that came out in 2023 it smells nothing new, you get the blood orange on the opening and when it dries down it’s almost similar to the og Legend… just meh .. I’ll use it as gym/work smell for the wintertime due to the warm freshness and being quite inoffensive :)

The longevity of this cologne has improved since I first bought it. Initially, I noticed it lasted about 5 to 6 hours, but now I am getting more than 8 hours of wear with good projection. This cologne is perfect for anyone who enjoys citrus-heavy or fresh scents.

I got this as a gift from a friend. I liked what he smelled like so he got me a bottle.

It's masculine. Its spicy with a dry wood note like oak maybe...I'm not getting the cedar. Its got sweet top notes I assume are the blood orange. Its a citrus sweet without being acidic. It's associated with being at work for me since my friend uses it.

it's better than the white one that just smells like an after gym musky spicy generic mess. That same spice is in legend red and I think that's the tipping point for me. It's an old school spice / musk that isn't my thing.

It's not fresh on me . It's a bit of a woody musky orange that comes off a bit too Mister Man for me. I like fragrances either darker or sweeter. For me this borders " Meh"...
Red shower gel scent. Like most Montblanc fragrances, it smells synthetic but offers a very good value for money ratio if you are looking for a low profile fragrance that smells good and modern.
I can't imagine this being anyone's favorite scent. It's pleasant but forgettable.
Blood orange prominent, and a nice woody base, good frag, legend Spirit still for the win 6.65/10

Opens and remains very much like a slightly fruitier, less dynamic Sauvage EDT. Very nice, pleasing red-fruit with fleeting woody tones in there. Projection is very, very minimal being really a skin scent as soon as I applied it. There is no trace of it left on my skin within 2 hours. Considering the price it's passable. Might be good for keeping in your gym bag when you need to freshen up for a bit. I wouldn't buy it again, just because of the performance. Scent is probably 7/10. Over all 6/10.

Like all Mont Blanc Legend frags, just wait out the hype and buy on the low. This is a very good smelling fragrance but it's just such a mix of other things that it lacks a wow factor. I just grabbed it for $29 full box presentation which is where this should be and not the full retail $115. If you need a versatile fragrance that smells good, is all season and for any dress up or down situation you can't go wrong with this one. Total blind buy worthy and covers all of the bases. Nice blood orange and sage scent with a slight woody undertone smoothed out by cardamom. You can't go wrong.
Versatile fresh citrus scent, wearable for school or job. Decent but basic.

This is a solid buy! I got 100 ml for $30 off of discounters and I couldn't be happier for that price. Retail has currently got this priced at $115 before tax. You could wear this anywhere at almost any time of the year. To me, it's best suited for the summer. It has a pleasant sweet woodiness that won't offend anyone. Average sillage and longevity.

I don't get the comparisons with K EDT or K EDP whatsoever. Sometimes I wonder if people actually smell similarities or see similar notes on fragrantica and make comparisons off of that. They both have blood orange at the top with juniper berries, clay sage, & cedar. I'm wearing both side by side and I can't say they smell similar. Both concentrations of K have something a little bit harsh in them which I can understand why many people wouldn't like them. K EDT almost has a wet paint smell to me. This one is smooth and pleasant all the way through.

At $30 you seriously can't go wrong with a fragrance like this. Do yourself a favor and pick it up!

Got a tester for 30 dollars from discounters. Like all other Mont Blanc fragrances this is a great safe and versatile frag. Blind buy rating is 10/10. If you are a student and want something bang for the buck without smelling like synthetic pos and giving someone a headache, this is a great choice. It doesn't project much after a few hours.

I don't often snap buy a fragrance, but this one, I had to, there was something about that initial burst that kept me coming back to it, I'm not normally a lover of grapefruit, but it's delicious here, the combination of orange and grapefruit is so good, and unlike a lot of citrus notes, it sticks around a while. The drydown is very woody, and there are definitely hints of sage throughout. One of the best of the Legend line.
Such a beautiful, quality strong performing fragrance for an incredible price

This one has the DNA of middle school boy's body sprays, but in the best way. It's nostalgic but with better performance and quality than those fragrances we used in middle school. Honestly, I couldn't make out a single note more than another, it's a relatively generic woody masculine scent. That being said, the drydown is incredible. It blends with my body chemistry to just smell like my musk, but if my musk were delicious and incredible. I know this is a weird thing to say but some men have a pleasant, but slightly vaginal body odor. After a few hours this smelled exactly like that. I like it, but I could see someone else finding it gross.
would've loved it more if it wasnt for the harsh synthetic smell. i try my best to love this fragrance, but that damn synthetic always fucks it up. i love the scent, if i ignore the synthetic shit.

#698 in my "Tour de Fragrance"

Got this as a sample sprayette. This is a citrus freshie, heavy on the blood orange and grapefruit, short on the potency like every Mont Blanc. It's supposedly an EDP, but potency, and scent profile is similar to $25 Tommy Bahama colognes: Maritime, Maritime Deep Blue, Maritime Triumph, Maritime Voyage, St. Kitts. It's a safe, versatile scent, but not one that will get noticed and not worth $50+ to me.

Spicy, woody, and slightly citrusy. It's nice, not memorable, therefore it is a scent that I don't seek out often. I gave it 4 stars. It is also versatile in my opinion. Wearing it now and I am really happy with it. Inexpensive. A scent you can find at discount outlets that would make a nice gift.
!!!!!!!!!!!!FTR … This smells Nothing like D&G. K (To me)
Not overwhelming, not underwhelming, nobody will hate it. Don't wear it much but it's nice to bring out for a casual occasion
I love citrus mixed with woody. It's a perfect balance of fresh mixed with warmth. It's sweet but not too sweet and it's masculine.

This is such an underrated fragrance. Way better than legend spirit and definetely the best in the legend line and mont blanc. Its such a nice smell that I could smell all day and not be mad. Very good everyday fragrance for work/school or anything. Wouldn't recommend for cold weather tho.
I got pickles marinade with citruses. Can't stand this concoction. Good thing it doesn't project and last long.
Good every day citrusy and woody fragrance. Fresh and underrated
Such an underrated fragrance, better than the white one in my opinion
This scent reminds me of Oriflame Be The Wild Legend. Day- time and perfect for Spring, Summer and Autumn/Fall.
Love the opening, but the dry down is lackluster at best

The tonka bean in this really makes the citrus smell super good but sadly it doesn't last as much as I would want it to last, if i had to choose out of all the flankers, this would probably be last to buy but first to second best smelling.
I really like the smell the only problem is it does not last long at all like an hour
Close to being a top 5 for me but projection is a little low and drydown is a synthetic creed viking. Cherry coke with spices

This last long on me and is amazing quality for the $25/3.3oz you can find it for. It’s generic but not in a bad way you don’t even have to think when grabbing this one it’s a Swiss Army knife. My girl got me this for and legend esp for my bday and they both are blind buy safe compliment getters I have a huge collection and I find myself grabbing the legends 😂 don’t get why people take fragrances so serious talking about this is too herbal/ this is too weak. Bottom line It’s $25 and is made to smell grate to the masses in addition last longer than some $100+ fragrance for me spray your clothes.
I disliked Herbal Notes 🌿

It is a lovely scent. It is nothing groundbreaking, but that is most Montblanc fragrances. Having smelled it in the store, my first thought was that "it smells nice." Nothing groundbreaking as you expect from Montblanc fragrances. It reminds me of a combination of Legend edt and K edt. The longevity was surprisingly long-lasting on my skin. Don't recommend if you own k edt or k edp. I own k edp, and it feels like a redundant purchase, but the dry-down is different enough to make me want to keep it. The dry down is beautiful and my favorite part. As the user below mentioned, I can see the dry-down resembling Blue de Chanel Parfum.

If you like Bleu de Chanel parfum you will love this. Very very similar especially in the dry down. Totally inoffensive and immediately likable with an addictive top note that always forces me to overspray just so I can huff this intoxicating juice. I have too many fragrances ranging from $10-$400 and this makes me as excited to spray as any of them. And the excellent price makes the mediocre performance less of an issue as I just overspray it. 9/10 only because of performance which isn’t horrible just not as strong as I wish it was. Is this a unique, crazy, wild and offensive, off putting niche fragrance with eternal longevity? No. Is it absolutely great smelling from beginning to end for a great price? Yes. Criminally underrated.
It's a safe blind fragance for winter or going out but it's a generic fragance with nothing special, for the price you can buy another better options.

Don't get the hate or low rating. Is it a generic citrus fragrance, not unlike many others? Sure. But it's extremely well priced, very pleasant in the opening, and an incredibly safe blind buy and office scent. I actually was in Macy's a couple months back smelling some samples, and out of everything in their array of fragrances to test, this one struck me as the nicest overall. I actually went out and bought 9 bottles for my employees for Xmas! Is it a stunning, unique, niche fragrance that smells like piss and cumarin? No, and maybe that's why the snobs dunk on it.

Perfume delicioso. Esa salida fresca cítrica con ese toque de cardamomo hace que sea realmente del gusto de prácticamente todo el mundo. El secado es dulce, con ese toque aún presente de maderas. Perfume jovial, alegre. Transmite muy buena vibra. Perfecto en verano, primavera. Talvez otoño pero en días algo templados. En frío se va a desvanecer muy rápido. Cómo fragancia firma para el día a día es una cuestión de gusto personal diría yo aunque si iría muy bien. Botella preciosa. Longevidad baja llegando a unas 4-5 horas y proyección media. Pero todos sabemos que son contados los perfumes de diseñador que duran y proyectan mucho en la actualidad. Muy recomendado aún así. Perfecta compra a ciegas. Buen precio. 8.5/10 por la baja duración y estela nada mas
Smells like you put a quarter in the Cologne-o-matic 3000 and selected “2014”

Woody, Fresh Spicy, and slightly sweet. This fragrance is good for the gym but unfortunately doesn't have the best longevity. If anything I'd vouch for a different cologne since this one is somewhat mediocre. Mediocre doesn't mean bad, since in the end it gets the job done well.

Opens spicy and aromatic with a cinnamon aroma.

It's quite fresh, also has some green notes.

It becomes "peppery", the notes are "spiky."

Smells like a forest. Notes of vetiver, pine/juniper. Then a citrus note and another fainter aroma that resembles peppermint.

It becomes herbaceous and sour, the vetiver lingers as does juniper. The drydown then becomes a faint woody skin-scent.

Performance is ok. Not a huge projector but lasts as a skin scent a good while. I could get whiffs of it quite a few hours after application.

Would suit a man 25+.

Fairly versatile. Would work well in most tempratures, but not something to wear for a date. More of an all-round daytime scent.

Does put me in mind of "Explorer Platinum." I think I prefer that though.
Smells like every other citrus forward masculine fragrance.

Great and unique blood orange scent.
Wish longevity was better.

Legend Red is a great fragrance if you´re planning to make it your only signature, its inoffensive and likeable however if you own even a small collection, this is not worth your money... It´ll collect dust as you´ll find it doesn´t stand out either as a summer scent, work scent or date night. A Jack of all trades but never a King!
Underrated day-time (office safe) freshie for the summer this one. Very safe and will offend no one.

Immediately reminded me of BDC (any of them), with that familiar "citrus/woods/ambroxan" combo. Obviously this is much cheaper and performance is subpar, but nonetheless, a fine-smelling fragrance. I don't think it smells much at all like original Legend (which smells like FIERCE). This is a good (entry-level) dumb reach that is safe in any occasion.
I don't know why it's over-disliked, it smells fairly good.

It actually smells really good and the juniper keeps it fresh. It is not overloaded with tonka or sweet notes. They could have named this "Sport" and gotten away with it. It's aggressive but unremarkable. Don't expect the mahogany to make this stand out. It smells like 40 other perfumes made in the last decade and the performance is average. This is a ~$30-range day scent. Please do not pay more for it than that. It is completely redundant if you have anything out of the "reminds me" section.

Not something I will say very special or groundbreaking but it just smells good, like really good, and nobody is going to be offended by it. I think it really works well in summer (can't comment on other seasons as I'm living in a summer-only country) and any occasions.

Very underrated and personally my favorite out of the whole legend line. Fresher, sweeter and not so intense like the Legend EDP.

Opening: Blood Orange, Wood

Mid: Wood, Blood Orange

Drydown: Ambroxan, Creamy Tonka, Wood, slight Soapyness

A very basic but very pleasing fragrence. Super mass appealing. Most people will like it. A lot of fragrence snobs will hate it. Good signature scent, and could be worn year round. Longevity is very average.

My buddy who is not into fragrences and thinks most of my collection is weird/stinks walked into Ulta and picked this out from everything on the shelf.

You can safely blind buy this office scent. It is versatile enough to be worn in most seasons. I don't think it is strong enough for winter wear, and at the price this will likely land at once it hits discounters, it will be a good deal. It reminds me of a couple of other colognes I own, Hugo Boss Energise and Polo Red, both inoffensive scents. The opening is citrussy, but there is a synthetic quality to the woodsy notes. I like the dry down as it smells clean, but it does not project for very long. I do not get much Tonka.

Smell 3/5
Longevity 2/5
Sillage 3/5

I received this for Christmas from my wife. It is a fresh spicy scent that is a bit generic... I feel that the woodsy and spicy notes feel synthetic. I like the opening quite a bit... the middle clary sage is the most noticeable. I do not get any Tonka Bean in the base, but the Cedar is present. I do not know what Mahogany smells like. I have a piece of mahogany furniture. I smelled it and can only smell pledge. This doesn't smell like pledge. I will use this as a day scent but not for occasions where I'm trying to get noticed. It is pretty versatile and would say that you can wear it any season during the day. It feels too fresh for an evening scent.

Smell 3/5
Longevity 4/5
Sillage 3/5

Take your generic citrus fragrance that you may all know and love, and add a little spice to it. That is Montblanc Legend Red summed up.

It must come from that grapefruit note, but I very much enjoy this. I have learned that I like clary sage in fragrances as well, it's herbal and fresh, Montblanc Legend Red will have you smelling fresh and clean, inoffensive, safe.

Unfortunately, this may fall in the redundant section in your collection :/
I cannot seem to find really long lasting fresh fragrances, it can be frustrating.

Legend Red is blind-buy safe, clean, nice and simple. I will wear this often at home or for errands, but it may fall through the cracks.

8.2/10

Edit: I have since received compliments at work while wearing this fragrance, even from office spaces numerous cubicles away from me! i guess it does project fairly well :)
I must say, I have been really enjoying this

Don’t like the clary sage note here. It reminds me of l’Homme Rochas.
In the drydown, I get ambroxan in a similar way like in Coolwater Parfum.
And now we also have a Montblanc "Most Wanted" Amberwood thingy in case you needed one. I didn't.

Really nice. A casual, pleasant, breezy scent. Perfect balance of citrus and woodsy notes. Rich, natural, and calming. Slightly sweet. This could work in all seasons but it would be especially good for fall and winter.

I just bought this perfume..nice smell in first opening..citrus and later becoming woody scent..I use it for casual day..spl for me is average..
my rating is 7 out of 10

What a pleasant surprise!

Honestly, I have *very* low expectations for Montblanc perfumes as they usually (with the exception of Starwalker, which I adore) make perfumes for 'mature' people, and I am not a fan of mature scents or scents that smell like 200-year molded furniture in Cambridge, England.

I was initially quite wary about blind buying any Montblanc perfumes due to the reason aforementioned, and to top it off, I had a rather bad experience with the overhyped Legend Spirit (the white bottle) so naturally my expectations were as low as they could be for this one.

But... I am also a victim of good designs and flashy bottles, and boy did they nail it with Legend Red. It's so bright Ferrari red that I could hardly resist, plus, I was able to get one at a pretty decent price from Montblanc official online shop in Thailand, so I gave it a go. At least I wouldn't regret the bottle, if nothing else, and the notes looked appealing enough for me, so...

The perfume came. I opened the beautiful red box to uncover a gorgeous red bottle (I don't have any bright red bottle fragrances in my collection, you see) and gave it a try.

It exceeded my expectations. I know that my bar set for it was very low so almost anything would exceed my expectations, but it did so in such a way that I wouldn't mind wearing it every now and then, and this alone is saying a lot.

The woody strangely overpowers the citrus here, but I can definitely smell the citrus underneath. It's not a heavy scent, thankfully, and thus I wouldn't classify it as 'mature' (again, thankfully). Perhaps this is why many below complained about its 'poor performance' whilst I don't mind at all. Yes, there is that Legend Spirit DNA in here, too, but it's not as pungent and it just smells... better. Normally I am against the idea of fragrances having genders but I would not recommend women to wear this one even though the bottle would surely attract all genders. It's quite clearly a man's fragrance, suitable for most daytime occasions in the spring and fall. I believe it would not trigger any unwarranted red flags or nausea unless you bathe in it. Longevity is moderate. Sillage is quite low, close to the skin, which I appreciate.

All in all, I am glad I got this one eventually. I was eyeing on it since it was released (though paradoxically with low expectations) as I was attracted to the bottle design and that bright red colour. To learn that the scent works for me is truly a blessing. Yes, some might say it smelt generic and nonesuch, but still, it exceeded my expectations remarkably.

Give it a try if you can. At least it's much more affordable than their pens, watches, and bags.

This is such a conflicting fragrance for me because I absolutely LOVE the scent profile. The sweetness, the spices, the woodiness, all of it is just so pleasant for me. To me this is perfect for all seasons except Summer (I live in a very hot climate so this could be different in a temperate climate.)

The downside is truly a big one, the performance. I find that I have bad skin chemistry and I generally don't get good performance on all my frags but this one is especially disappointing. The initial blood orange opening lasts about 15 mins and after like 2 hrs, on my skin, this is undetectable. This is not strong enough to make me go noseblind so I know it's not that. I wouldn't be so frustrated if I didn't like the scent so much.

Alas, I'd never get rid of it but it may end up being a frag I spray on a strip when I feel like smelling it and not really for wearing.

A mulled spice version of Legend. It's a bit sweeter too. Kind of just reminds me of Polo Red or Old Spice deodorants. Legend is my favorite to smell on my boyfriend but Legend Red can be a good fall and winter variety to feel comfy and spicy. Just like Legend this is work and office safe and a good blind buy. Sillage is good; when my boyfriend is in the car with me I can smell the fragrance the whole time and if we go shopping the scent trails alongside him. Longevity is good also.

Slightly sweeter. Slightly more citrus. Slightly lighter version of the original. Just like the rest of the line, they don't stray too far away from the original DNA. The opening is the best where you get that big hit of sweet citrus. Soon after it settles down into a lighter fruity, woody scent of the original. All in all this smells good. It shouldn't offend anyone. Performance is on par with the rest, around 5-6 hours. Could be worn year round. Seems best suited for cooler weather. This is one for anyone that just wants to smell good.

I love the refreshing, zesty opening! There's a bitter edge and a warm, inviting background as it dries down. This scent is casual but interesting at the same time. I would recommend to wear this on a first date; it's unique but not too crazy!

I have this one as a birthday gift, at first I was like meh/okay but, trying it for more days I started to give it a solid like. The opening it’s the highlight in this one, after that it’s just ok. It’s a good price, it’s an easy nice fragrance I would use daily or for any informal/casual occasion. The best season I would say it’s spring, daytime, but also fits summer and warm autumn days.

I like this one but don’t love it and I think if this has a few adjustments to it that it could be a top tier fragrance, however this has a beautiful opening but while it’s still good in the mid and drydown it just doesn’t compare to the opening (which I know the purpose of this is to be a money grab)

Again the opening to this is beautiful as it has a beautiful citrus note that’s clean but also has just the right amount of sweetness to be appealing but also stand out and be slightly different ! However, once this dries down it’s still good but loses that beautiful citrus and dies down to a more flat,dull,woodier version of the opening ! In the mid and drydown this just becomes boring to me and although pleasant I’d still prefer to wear something else that’s either more pleasant or unique.

Performance on this is by far the least out of any Mont Blanc I own as they all have very good performance except this one. Legend Red lasts me 4-5 hours with only decent projection for 30 minutes before becoming a faint skin scent.

Decent scent that I can see someone that isn’t into colognes making this a signature scent as it’s very pleasant but if you have an experienced nose this is a pass as there are many better “mass appealing “ colognes out there

Overall rating -6.5 out of 10 ! Love the opening but not a fan of the other aspects of the fragrance
I was surprised that it got a very good low rating, I liked it very much, it's definitely one of the best perfumes to buy at this price
If you want a fragrance that makes women around you to complement that scent of yours this Montblanc Legend is a good investment. It’s fresh, sexy and lasts long. What else would you need?

You'd think with this note breakdown that it would be a fall or winter scent, but it's almost strictly a spring scent. Too warm to wear in the summer, not strong enough for the winter. You could also wear it during the fall, but ideally just spring in 10 degree weather.

I'll test again come spring.

I like it. Modern masculine scent for men. Woody and fresh. Great for office and daily use. Spring would be the optimal season. Can be worn other seasons as well. Nothing unique, but modern and mass appealing.

It’s an ok, better than average fragrance.
The dry down notes are detectable and decent but the pass-through is rapid.
The base is woody and pleasant with a touch of sweetness.
Ok for everyday wear and pretty harmless as a casual frag. Suitable for the office too… a prototypical Swiss Army Knife frag.
The department store prices are outrageous for something that fits the Marshall’s $29.99 mold.
Smells like some Axe deodorant I used in college in 2006, but leaning femenine... Doesn't project and lasts 3 hours, If you like it, get it if you see it for less than $35

Don't have one yet but it would be my next buy if I had the funds for it and urgently needed a summer perfume. I've been dreaming of it ever since the sales girl in one of my local stores forced me to try on skin. Usually they don't know much about fragrances and just make random suggestions to customers based on the little they know or on which brand is paying them a commission at the moment. Upon the sales girl's insistence I relented and gave it a go and... surprise, I think it smells delicious. Not as distinctive as the Starwalker I have at the moment, but this base notes combination is to die for. Rare example of a frag that gets off to a hesitant start but then gets better by the hour :)
It’s ok, generic, pleasant. If you are looking for something to just put on and not think much about it.

The reviewers on YouTube were correct about this one. It is not as good as the other legend line. The opening is very nice, but the dry down goes away. There isn't much of the legend DNA in this one which is unfortunately. I bought it to complete my legend collection. I would seriously wait until this one goes to discounters and pick up for 30 bucks. it is not worth retail. So many fragrances for the same money out there are better.

Blind bought this with regret, it's okay nothing impressive. I rather rock bleeker st by bond 9 wherever I decide to wear this one but my bleeker st is like 12 sprays away from bye bye so it wear this sometimes till I get another bottle of bleeker

I'm halfway through my bottle, and this one is an easy like. There's nothing challenging here -- I agree that it's designed for the guy who only has a bottle or two and couldn't care less about notes and such. The pyramid is accurate: citrus and woods, all sort of candied. I've received lots of compliments, and my wife loves it on me and in the air. Performance is moderate to strong, but it's never overwhelming. This is focus group perfumery at its finest and a safe blind buy/gift!
🎵I like it… I really really like it…🎶 like so many of the other perfumes by different designers. Too many, making it mundane.

Uninspiring yet inoffensive, flat, and generic-but-pleasant ‘freshie’ - smooth blood orange & cedar accord with a faint herbal hint. An easy gift for someone who’s not a ‘fragrance person.’

For a supposed ‘eau de parfum’ the performance is badly lacking - never more than a skin scent even when sprayed heavily.

@mwtx said it best in his review below. Mass appealing and synthetic. Having worked in fragrance for quite some time, I’ll tell you EXACTLY why this one gets recommended - to people that don’t know what they like (and/or people who just want one fragrance and nothing more), this is the best thing since sliced bread. Personally, I don’t get it. It’s okay. Like most of the Legend line, it’s inoffensive and versatile.

Montblanc are the masters of making fragrances for non fragrance people. I can’t fault them for it, and this would make a great first fragrance for someone (or a great ONLY fragrance) but, quite frankly, I wouldn’t say it’s worth picking up for most people.

Nothing groundbreaking but it does smell really good. Juicy blood orange, and grapefruit, woody cedar. Reminds me of K by D&G, except that the juniper here isn’t really detectable. This is masculine, fresh, sexy. It smells like a handsome man after a shower. This is a fresh crowd pleaser for sure, sort of like Sauvage or Dylan Blue. Performance is ok, not bad for a fresh fragrance. I got about 5-6 hours.

8/10
Very masculine, professional and clean vibe. It reminds me of a well-dressed masculine man wearing a classy watch. Very versatile.

1990's cologne & sweet vanilla dry down.

6.8/10
Such a great fragrance. Has good performance. I definitely approve this. If you like the K line this is not the same. It’s in the same vein and imo this is better by a long shot
this one has no specialty. it has montblanc legend kind of DNA but smells like cheap fruity perfume you can buy from 1 dollar shop. super normal and typical fruity smell.

Montblanc Legend with a woody, citrusy twist.

Legend Red (LR) takes the same original Legend's (OGL) fresh base, the A&F Fierce base, and hides it behind hefty doses of citruses and wood.

Fresh, zesty citruses, mainly grapefruit, woodied up with beautiful saffron-y mahogany wood, and an unfortunately generic fresh woody accord of tonka, cedar, and juniper. The combination is spiced up very lightly with soft cardamom juniper berries, and all is built on a faint fresh base of the OGL of sage, juniper, and citruses.

Woody, citrusy, lightly-spicy, fresh, slightly green and aromatic.

My hopes for this one were higher but I was a little let down by the scent. The generic woody accord takes away from RL's beauty.

Nonetheless, this is worth re-visiting for me as I find the saffron-y woody accord's clash with citruses quite nice, and I do like OGL's fresh DNA faint in the background.

I had the chance to test Montblanc’s Signature Elixir last week, in El Corte Ingles, during a trip in Malaga and I was instantly impressed. It’s not the type of scent I would wear in a 35 Celsius degrees heat, but I gave it a try anyway, being a big fan of original Signature.

First of all, it’s nothing like the original or the Absolue Signature, so not really the original line DNA with a small twist. It’s an entirely new scent, with a dark, rich, warm, ambery facets, in a vibrant red bottle, the kind of colour that matches the juice inside. Signature Elixir is a sweet, warm, cozy, floral, vanilla scent at core with a more sophisticated allure. I like it a lot, but I have decided to purchase other fragrances from my wish list, because…limited space in the luggage. If you shop a lot during holidays, you know what I mean.

For a brand new release, it wasn’t priced too bad, it was around 100 euros per 90 ml bottle! Obviously not the cheapie, like OG Signature is, but it had good longevity on the blotter, more of a moderate radiance in the air and the presentation is great. Really nice release, different than the others in the line, but not a groundbreaking perfume.

More of a spring and fall scent, it’s a bit richer, sweet, deeper than something I would like to wear during summer months.

Montblanc Explorer is a designer take on Creed's Aventus. It's a smoother, less smoky, and more mass-appealing version of the OG Aventus, if you will.

Performance is nothing to write home about, and to be honest, for an eau de parfum concentration, it's kinda underwhelming. This one has moderate projection and longevity on my skin on a good day.

All in all, this is an okay alternative to the Aventus DNA. It's fresh, mass-appealing, and will get the job done. But nowadays, everyone and their pops are rocking an Aventus or a clone of Aventus, so you will not be the most unique-smelling person in the room wearing this. If you want a true clone of Aventus, go with one of Armaf's Club de Nuit. If you want a watered-down and more citrusy version of Aventus, this one is for you.

Lo! At this point in my review I can hear a perfume hobbyist's mouth frothing in the distance. I hear the cry, "B-but... this is just aventus! It's so unoriginal!! I need something challenging!!"

Indeed! MB Explorer isn't challenging.

It won't make you smell like a rare, esoteric strain of beaver urine drizzled over a mountain of burning tires at the start of the harvest season. It won't make you smell like an dirt-ridden, soggy, milk stained flannel. It might not even make you smell like a perfume-clever-clogs-man-of-distinguished-taste who stands out from the crowd.

However, Explorer does smell good. The first time I wore this, I immediately received a compliment. The advantage of being aventus-inspired and not aventus-impersonating means that this stands alone as a perfume in its own right, unlike the tiresome aventus clones that get wheeled out day after day.

Probably the best-smelling clone of Aventus on the market, but I wish the longevity could have been better. Great scent all the way from the opening to the end skin scent mark. CDNI has better performance, but the scent of Explorer is closer to Aventus and does a better job. Another great alternative would be Bujairami Kingsmen Extrait de Parfum which has a great performance and a good scent profile.
Safe, pleasing, but very mundane.

This is another variant in the aventus clones family. it is smoother than CDNIM.
Performance is above average but I say this after over spraying. I usually overspray summer fragrances.
Longevity is 7-8 hours with soft projection from the start to the end.

This is slightly more refined than CDNIM, Afnan not only intense & the other cheap clones.
I can buy a bottle if the price is 45$ no more.

After shave…
Edit: Okay! After I’ve smelt this on my boyfriend’s skin for a couple weeks I love it!! It’s sooo sexy on him. I stick my face in the hollow of his neck and can’t help myself. The first impression wasn’t good. You gotta let it get in your skin chemistry. Smelling it on paper isn’t a real test with this one.

I prefer the scent over CDNIM, however, the performance is a joke in my skin. It barely even last like 3 hours, maybe I got nose blinded by it, due to the ambroxan or just the projection is weak, either way, I don’t know if the price justifies this fragrance if CDNIM exists or even other Aventus clones/inspirations.

Don’t get me wrong, the presentation looks good, the bottle is great for the price and the scent too but the performance is hard to justify for it. You can overspray but still the performance is indeed disappointing but the scent is great.
what a wasted potential, they had a really good bottle design and branding, then they fumbled by making a dupe that costs 150$. is this the innovation that capitalism is incentivizing people for ?

Review #5 , Mount Blanc explore the Bergamont and Sage is a very underrated combo
It’s always a say but buying blue cologne this is one of them

Uber masculine fresh and metallic like smell
Like daddy’s new car. Opens synthetic but drys down
Into refreshing spicy silage .
It’s something almost every adult male will like ,makes it a great and affordable gift for Father’s Day.
Performance is not that bad either.
7/10 for me

Montblanc Explorer is easily the longest lasting fragrance I own. Even outlasting JPG Elixir and Sauvage Elixir. After reading all the reviews, your batch code is very important. Legitimately, my batch of Explorer is absolutely beast mode in every category. My batch code (the one I strongly recommend) is 03P20P096

With that being said, I personally prefer Explorer over Aventus or Aventus Cologne. Aside from it out performing Aventus in every category, Explorer seems smoother, sweeter, and more balanced than the batches of Creed I tried. Additionally, the women prefer Explorer more than Aventus. I had my fiancé blind smell Explorer, Aventus, and Aventus Cologne and everytime Explorer was the favorite.

Lastly, Explorer is a very budget friendly fragrance. I would encourage you to look for my specific batch code for beast mode performance. But with the recent prices hovering between $30-$60, it’s an absolute steal and blind buy safe.

Overall, Montblanc Explorer is an excellent take of Creed Aventus. With my experiences, Explorer is more preferred for your wallet and other people’s noses.

Great scent. Love the bergamot and spicy open. Subtle leather in the dry down is really nice. I leave this in my car as my on the go scent. Works well in the car with the leather note. Performance is not the best which is another reason it works good as my car scent. Spray it on as I pull up to a spot, smell good for a few hours, you're golden.

This is honestly really nice. As others have stated, this is not an Aventus clone - I actually like this more, and I think it’s much better value. It swaps out the fruity pineapple for citrus and something a bit crispy and green, which must be the sage. The opening to this is peppery, but the dry down is a dark, incense-laced wood. I can see this working for most seasons, and would be an easy one to transfer from day to night with.

I’m inclined to go for something a bit more niche, but this is lovely for what it is. Definitely going into rotation for me as an everyday option for work or events that is just easy to pick up and be a “crowd pleaser” for those situations.

don't know why everyone says it's not long lasting
my bottle last minimum 8 hrs on skin and 24 hr on clothes and projects very nicely for 3-4 hrs

Like others have echoed on this review board: if you’re coming into this expecting an Aventus clone, you will be disappointed. While it has some similarities, it does things a bit differently and should be viewed as its own thing.

Honestly, I really enjoy Explorer - to the point where it’s now become a favourite of mine. It surprised me when I finally got my nose on it (and I kept my expectations in check). I recently bought a full bottle and have been using it almost daily ever since.

It starts with a bright burst of citrus and zesty pepper but calms down into a smooth woody patchouli scent profile. There is also a “greenness” to it that I enjoy. The scent radiates like crazy as my fiancé commented for hours after how she could still smell it despite only using a couple of sprays. Definitely potent stuff and a great performer (at least for me on my skin).

It’s a very masculine scent. I think it leans more mature personally but I do know some people think younger folks can wear it too. I’d also say it’s fairly versatile - good for day or night across seasons, and both casual and dressed up situations (just use the right amount of sprays). That being said, I think it’s a bit too sophisticated and overwhelming for the gym so that is one use-case I’d avoid.

Overall, if you are looking for a solid, masculine scent and are a fan of the note breakdown, it’s a no brainer (especially when purchased for a good price via discounters).
This isn’t really an Aventus dupe, it’s more like a different take. Aventus is super fruity, while this leans citrusy and has that aromatic vibe Aventus doesn’t.

Explorer can be characterized as an interpretation of Aventus, yet it stands as an independent fragrance distinguished by its light and aromatic qualities, enhanced by the notes of bergamot, vetiver, and patchouli. It is an ideal fragrance for both everyday wear and formal occasions, exuding a smooth and masculine scent. While not overpowering, its presence is subtle and noticeable throughout the day. Wearing this fragrance is not intended to impress others; rather, it is a personal choice for enhancing one’s aroma. Unlike fragrances sought after for compliments, Explorer simply captures attention in a positive way.

Explorer is particularly suitable for office wear or travel due to its moderate intensity. Its projection is not overly strong, lasting approximately two hours at arm length, and its longevity is approximately five to six hours, with a lingering skin scent of Ambroxan thereafter.

An excellent everyday wear in most occasions all year round.

BUT: I’ve had several bottles of this over the last couple of years. A couple of the 30ml travel size, a 60ml and now just recently a 100ml bottle. The other smaller bottles always had great performance but this newer 100ml bottle is a real letdown. I love the fragrance and with 3-5 sprays (some on skin and some on clothes) it’s gone within an hour or two. And I’m not going nose blind - nobody else can smell it either.

What happened to the formulation?? The smaller bottles from a couple of years ago would last 6 hours at least, especially on clothing. Doesn’t really seem worth the now elevated price unless you can get it from a discounter for a good deal.

That's why I never blind buy anything. This smells very close to Aventus on a strip of paper, but it's totally different when sprayed on my wrist. Weak projection, stays close to the skin and all I get is just the smoke note. Disappointing. I'm so glad I did not buy this. Lesson: always try fragrances on your own skin and wear them for a while, you can never really tell how they will work based on just a paper sample.

Perfect alternative to the creed DNA. Performs well and people enjoy it. Instead of getting one of the ME clones I recommend trying this and seeing if it scratches the itch. If you get it from a discounter the price difference isn’t much and it won’t need maceration or have a harsh opening
i didnt even notice it smells like creed until this page says it! 😆😅 clean and fresh!

Montblanc Explorer might be the greatest work scent in the entire fragrance universe. Nobody will take anything negative from it... everybody will think you smell really good. It blows my mind how well-received (and compliment-pulling) this fragrance is in a work environment... it just lands so well with female coworkers. I don't fully understand it.

Now.... If you want something a bit more pushy for non-work use, here's a tip — decant and mix Explorer about 60/40 with Afnan Supremacy Not Only Intense. The result is FANTASTIC; it really kicks up the performance of Explorer, plus it fills out the fragrance with more depth and sweetness from the black currant, giving you something much closer to the original Aventus (minus the pineapple, which I never liked). I think this mix beats Aventus outright.

But even on its own...... Explorer is an incredibly effective do-it-all scent — far more effective than you might expect if you're a fragrance buff.

This to me is a manlier, more masculine version of Aventus. It's like Explorer is a sexy, outdoorsy lumberjack and Aventus is his city boy, dressier cousin. There's a after-shave scent hier that Aventus doesn't have. I bought Creed for me and Explorer for a male family member and wearing both on my elbows I prefer the smell of Aventus on me, a woman.
Truly a fools' aventus. It's not original, but I love the pineapple they brought up, making this surprisingly manly

I blind bought this as a young guy with little fragrance experience. I'd heard it was a safe blind buy and even could be uses as an office scent.

Boy was I in for a shock. As soon as I smelled this, it reminded me of old men, with beard stubble sharp enough to sand down 4x4s. I don't know what note or molecule is giving that effect for me, but to my nose it smells harsh and musky.

All I can detect is musk, leather, and smoke. I wonder if it's the patchouli, or the vetiver, or the ambroxan that has this effect on me. It's not that it smells bad, it's interesting but it smells very strong and hyper manly.

What I've learned from trying this and blind buying a few more fragrances (foolishly), is that I strongly prefer scents that are unisex or masculine leaning, but not so masculine that I couldn't imagine a woman being able to wear it.

This fragrance is basically just Aventus but with less depth and softer around the edges. To me it takes the idea of Aventus and strips away all the character, leaving only the core essence. Which is not to say that it is a bad fragrance, it smells nice. The opening is vaguely reminicent of Sauvage to me with the bergamont and pepper. It quickly turns into Aventus, though it doesnt have the same smokeyness that exists in Aventus. Longevity and projection on my skin are fine. While not a bad Aventus inspired fragrance, there are many similar fragrances that have more depth and character.

Opening pepper is strong and reminds Sauvage elixir for a minute, which I'm not a fan of. Dry-down gets a lot better when wood and sweetness come through, making it inoffensive office scent.Would not bank on it when on a date tho :)

+ Well blended
+ Does not smell cheap or low quality
+ Pretty decent value wise

- Smell does not "wow" anyone
- Performance is barely ok - scent sits very close to skin
- There are better alternatives for the money.

Yes, the scent smells very nice, I think there would be no one who would not like it, but its performance is really noticeably low. I have been using it for about 8 months, but there are question marks about distribution and performance. If you don't have much performance anxiety and want to smell nice, 10/10!!

This is 1 to 1 to Aventus’s opening. They differ in scent after 10-15 or so minutes as Explorer goes more to a fresh/woody citrus in contrast to Aventus becoming a smokier scent. I genuinely believe this to be the best cheap beginner friendly fragrance ever.

Easiest dumb reach of all time, sadly it does seem like I go noseblind to this quickly however. Spray on clothes for the maximum performance.

8 / 10

If it had better perceived performance it would be a strong 8, weak 9.
Very nice fragrance. This one has landed me the most compliments of all my fragrances. Can’t go wrong with this one. Perfect office scent.

I have a 5ml sample that I've been using every now and then for the past 2 months. I really liked it at first, it smells very manly, leathery, spicy, but now I get headaches when I wear it that persist until I wash it off.
Very strong opening but when it settles down, it smells nice. Okay 6/10!

It's a good everyday scent. Nothing crazy and it doesn't pop too much, but it smells good and can be found really cheap at discounters. Solid pickup for work and daytime, but gets a little lame after months of use because there isn't anything special

it's good smell and smooth, but weak longevity and sillage no hope for maceration for better performance maybe that weak performance is good for some people

if you want to chill at home and smell good without annoying yourself or someone around you this is good choice!
spray after shower and sit in your sofa and watch TV, if you step outside the house the smell will fade in 2 hours or less

this's summer and spring perfume in winter no chance.
6.5/10

I like the drydown of Mont Blanc Explorer. It reminds me a bit of the drydown of Brunello Cucinelli Pour Homme. I think the ambroxen shared by both have a lot to do with that. But pepper, clary sage, and woods have something to do with it too. The Explorer scent profile is sort of like an Aventus/Brunello Cucinelli Pour Homme hybrid. Certainly enough of a profile variance with Aventus to make Explorer an interesting and affordable alternative, yet similar enough to interest fans of the Aventus profile.

Lime and Pine, then mostly Pine. A lot like Aspen, with a spritz of lime juice. Then it's just like wearing Aspen. Between this and L'Aventure, I now know Aventus DNA is not for me. I'm just not into smelling like a pine tree. I will say Explorer is not as offensive as L'Aventure, since at least the lime smell fades quickly. Fortunately, I only got a sample bottle.
Smelled it once and it smelled like sweat, smelled it again and it smells like nice woods and citrus. Not really sure which impression was accurate.

Clean, fresh, and super easy to wear. It’s got that woody, citrusy, and just classy. Great for everyday use, gets compliments, and honestly feels way more expensive than it is. But I wouldn't say that it is a clone of the Aventus, as it is way less fruity and lasting than the Aventus. Overall, it can be a solid choice for a signature scent.
Kind of pricey for what it is. There are better smelling and better performing Aventus clones for less. I bought as a blind buy from Burlington for really cheap but would not purchase again.

It’s a knockoff of Aventus.

There’s little of that Aventus here; it’s an Aventus-like mist that dissipates, pointless.

This was one that sort of jumped-started my frag journey even though I moved on to many other scents for some time. Anyway, I picked up a 30ml last night at Burlington’s for way cheap, and I gotta say it’s like an old friend. Really came here to say that I’m not having issues with performance. I guess it’s truly hit or miss for everyone which is a bummer. I have one spray on each wrist and it’s giving consistent wafts as I move about the day. Can’t really speak on longevity just yet, but as far as sillage—yeah man it’s there.

Smells really good and is 100% worth the price. To me it also has a slightly fruity side to it which I don’t see many people talk about, but it’s overall a very masculine fragrance. It’s lacking performance tho, so I recommend overspraying with this one, but overall a good fragrance

im absolutely addicted to this scent profile. this doenst smell like aventus, or cedrat boise, or hacivat. i like this stuff a lot, it was one of my first real frags. the sage that pierces through with the pepper and patchouli reminds me of the pine smells when walking around my neighborhood. i think it's really the addition of sage that makes me like explorer so much. wish this lasted longer, but def one of my signature scents. also the price for retail is great, unbeatable on Jomashop
The cheapest one in my collection, yet the most complimented by far.

I've been wearing and collecting cologne since I was 14, I am 18 now. So, i've gone through a lot of cologne and realized that I only really needed one cologne and for me this was the one. I've worn this cologne to the gym, work, school, and other occasions. I just spray and go and It does the job very well. This cologne is a very nice citrus with a nice woody background. It's more subtle than it is strong, which I prefer because I don't like the nauseating/cloying effect of a strong cologne. I fell in love with this cologne and will continue loving it. I will definitely be buying another bottle once I am finished with this one.

This is a great, great fragrance for what it is. And this is an important point. Yes, it is heavily inspired on Aventus, but they didn't try to recreate it exactly or give it a boost on performance or a twist or whatever, like other inspirations. Montblance took that and tried to make a designer version of that fragrance, taking its strengths into the desinger world and functionality, what does this means? Well That it is maybe not as deep or complex as the original Aventus (which isn't very artistry for that matter) but took the profile into a super mass appealing, versatile, and modern masculine territory, and in that regard they understood the asignment really well.

In the opening you can smel a bit citrusy pink pepper (which is a fresh and invigorating spice for itself) and then the vetiver is what takes the show, but not a classic/barbershop vetiver, is a more earthy, dark, woody and modern vetiver that feels masculine and modern. Not blue, "fresh and clean" or shower gel by any means so its a great alternative to all that genre that still feels safe and appealing without being teeny or sweet in the slightest. And yes the superpower of this is that is extremely versatile both in profile and performance-wise, from jeans and hoodie to semi formal you will always smell good and masculine without trying hard or making an statement. I actually use my bottle as my "ultra casual" scent: videogames nights with friends, lazy sundays, supermaket, late night tacos, whatever, is subtle but last a good 3-4 hours so take that, is is not any bomb frag. Maybe I would love it more if it was a bit stronger but it is what it is I guess. Still this is one of the best dumb reaches in modern masculine perfumery. Like, if you could only have a single designer fragrance this could be a heavy contender

Is funny how people see Ambroxan as a note and immediately start making comparisons with Sauvage like it is the Ambroxan staple. This does not smell remotely close to Sauvage in any department. And Ambroxan is used in so much more fragrances that the ones that list it in modern perfumery.

One of those everyday / grab and go fragrances. Nothing special about it, does the job.

3.5/5

This is just a banger. It's sad that it was written off as an Aventus wannabe and lives in its shadow, only getting recognition based on a few notes they share in common, and being judged only by how similar it is to Aventus.

It is, in fact, a masterpiece in its own right.

I have a modest collection and lots of samples, but I'm continually reaching for this bottle for the refreshment and joy I know it will bring me when I spray it on. It's also gotten the most compliments of anything I own.

For the price, I can afford to spray as much as I want, whenever I want. It's an excellent value. I carry a bottle with me so I can get my fix.

Just buy it. You can thank me later.

its good, its similar to aventus but not as pineapple or musk driven, it has a similar sweetness but takes a toned down earthy and spicy approach making it feel even more suited for an office. it gets me the most compliments and is reliable for any occasion, its easy to like, this is one of the favourites of people around me next to le sel dissey and reflection man. this is devoid of any journey or artistic boldness so dont expect that. if im having a day where i just want to smell likeable and without any of my own ideas put on a fragrance this is my go to

So i purchased a big bottle of this stuff right at the beginning of building an actual collection in 2023. Back then, I was definitely chasing longer lasting frags, big scent bubbles, all of that. Gave the bottle away after purchasing cdnim edp, and getting insane performance from it. After giving my bottle of MBE away, I very soon, and for a solid uear, regretted it and wanted this stuff back in my collection, so I caved and bought it again.

This is EASILY my favorite fresh type fragrance. It sits within the Aventus wheelhouse, but it severely lacks the birchy/smoky vibe of Aventus, leaving you a crazy fresh citrus, leather, ambroxen bomb. This is what I hoped Aventus would smell like, it's what I hoped CDNIM would smell like, but this? If you boosted the performance a bit more, this would be my end all be all fragrance. The one I reach for on days i don't know what to wear. I have noticed as the scent sits on you longer and longer, it does develop a somewhat "mossy" version of the smokiness that Aventus and CDNIM have, but its still different enough that I feel I could wear CDNIM or Aventus tomorrow to work, and it feel different, but as it goes, and especially gets later into the longevity, I do get a somewhat fresh smokiness that comes out more and more as it fades. As insanely redundant as it would be, I STRONGLY feel that one of these clone companies REALLY should take MBE apart, and then clone it exactly, but boost the performance a bit more, at it's price point (around $45US when I got a 3.4oz bottle) I wouldn't imagine it being that hard to pick apart and reproduce.

It's everything I fell in love with the first time, and maybe my nose has gotten smarter, but the performance seems to have actually improved on my end from the first bottle in 2023... The longevity as I sit, 7 hours into a wearing, it's still going, a bit lighter, but still going. I cant lie, I read SO many reviews here talking about a lacking atomizer, so I will admit, I gave it 26 sprays, and it gave me the desired performance. My first bottle, the last time I used it, 40 puffs, and it was gone 3 hours later. So either they improved it a bit, or my skin care routine is great. 😂 almost 10 hours into the wearing, and the longevity is still definitlely present on my shirt, but on skin, it is now a fairly light, but still noticeable skin scent. In the end, I'd give it about a 10 hour duration in total. Felt nice moving my moderate longevity rating here to a long lasting one.

The sillage is there, definitely lighter, inoffensive, and good for being around anyone sensitive to fragrance, but its not as light as some say. Definitely provides a little bubble through it's duration. It's just lighter than most, especially if you're used to beast mode stuff.

Pulled probably 5 or 6 compliments right off the bat in the first couple hours at work with this one too. my coworkers know I love fragrance, and atleast 3 of them had to know what it was I had on.

I do believe there is an anosmic trait to this fragrance a bit, as I was having a slightly hard time detecting it on myself at points, but at around the 8 hour mark of wearing it, I asked a coworker if they still smelled it, and they said absolutely, whereas in the moment, I 100% could NOT smell it on me at all.

For me, this one is reserved for the sticky hot summer days where I'm guaranteed to be hot and even sweaty. It seems to thrive in that environment especially. All in all, you could genuinely wear this for ANY occasion, day, night, hot, cold, it doesn't really matter. A great work fragrance as well. I personally would never use this in any weather under probably 80, but thats also why I have 52 other bottles to cycle out for the other weather.

REALLY glad I got another bottle of this. I'll actually end up using and enjoying this one. 😌 Don't be afraid to spray the shit out of it though... It's cheap enough that it didn't hurt burning through what most people would wear in a month, in one day. :P

A favourite. Slight citrus opening. More mellow than CDN, not as strong of a scent. No need for maceration. Vetiver and leather are primarily the notes that linger. Sillage was good and scent lasted a while, at least for my bottle. 10/10

Steer clear from this one if you're seeking an Aventus dupe. Its harsh on the nose and an obnoxious mix of Aventus and Sauvage. For a quarter of the price of Explorer, go for Zara Vibrant Leather Elixir which is a much better clone of Aventus.

4/10.
La mejor fragancia que he tenido nunca un 10/10 es súper versátil. es increíble merece la pena completamente. es genial para el verano y la primavera
This is a great everyday, masculine, fresh fragrance. The leather isn't the greatest but a solid dumb reach in summer
Fresh, pepper, citrus, spicy, amber. Something a little sweet. I like it.

Got the one ounce bottle and I'm wondering if that's why I find the projection to be atrocious. The sprayer/nozzle is pretty small on that bottle. Most of my criticisms revolve around that fact that it barely projects at all. But with that said, here's my experience: The intial spray of this smells like Aventus, dead on Aventus. And then Aventus is GONE for about three hours. What remains is a very weak smelling Montblanc Legend- actually to me it smells more like a $20 knockoff Sean Jean I bought in NYC a dozen years ago with barely enough oil in it to smell good for the instant that you spray it. This sits CLOSE to the skin. It is pleasant, but I'm not convinced anyone around you can smell it. Three hours after spraying it, a faint Aventus smell returns. Things smell nice, but perform poorly. The fragrance itself is extremely versatile and I think on a super hot day I wouldn't hesitate to reach for it like I do CDNIM. That one ounce bottle might contribute to a small spray/weak performance, but it makes a great travel bottle.

An excellent interpretation of Aventus. Maybe not as strong, doesn't last quite as long, doesn't project as well, but I think Explorer is comparable in all metrics. Great value for money. Not much else to say, other than this is pretty damn good!

I wore this again recently after many years and realized why I stopped wearing it: vetiver is the clear and dominant note. I don't dislike vetiver, but I would have preferred it to be more of a base note. Still, it's a pleasant fragrance and probably the best Aventus-like you can buy, although Aventus is very much more pineapple/birch rather than bergamot/vetiver.

Will always be my favorite Aventus style affordable alternative. The fresher take without the heavy smoky note is so well done. There have been so many clones but this still smells high quality unlike the many middle eastern takes. Those are good too, I just prefer this one. Lasts about 6-7hrs on me and I'm happy with that.

The opening notes in Explorer made me sigh in disappointment. As I continue learning and understanding my note preferences better, this one just wouldn’t make the list right off the bat.

It opens with a strong burst of vetiver, along with some other deep, unrecognisable notes that evolve into that classic masculine scent I dread the most. I'm still on the fence with vetiver. For now, I can tolerate Haitian vetiver, but not its woodier, deeper counterpart, Java vetiver. Fortunately, the vetiver in Explorer is Haitian, and it does become more subtle and toned down over time.

The bergamot disappears almost instantly. I couldn’t help but chuckle; it vanished like a breeze. Ambroxan steps in, replacing vetiver as the lead solo until the very end. It’s quite linear from start to finish, and I can definitely catch a bit of that Sauvage vibe.

My nose is still pretty green, and right now I’m leaning more towards freshies, so it makes sense why this one isn’t really hitting for me.

I expected bolder notes or riskier transitions, especially for something marketed as an ‘Explorer’ but it turned out to be a safe, mass-appealing ‘City Dweller’ that wouldn’t even dare venture down an alleyway, let alone the countryside.

Overall Scent Score: 5/10

I really appreciate what they are doing with this. Straight out of the box I found it very very different than what people claimed it to be. After letting it settle for couple of days I started to get the hype and after a week this frag proved itself.
A good investment..

Explorer by Montblanc is a chill, laid-back fragrance that I think most people would enjoy. It really shines on rainy days there's something about it that fits perfectly with the cool, wet atmosphere. It’s not too strong or in your face, just a smooth and easy scent to wear.

From my experience, the compliments I’ve received haven’t been anything over the top more like “Oh, that smells nice” rather than “Wow, what are you wearing?!” So while it might not turn heads, it definitely gets a solid “okay, good perfume” reaction, which is fine by me.

Overall, it's a safe, likeable fragrance that works well in casual settings and won’t offend anyone around you.
Citrus and pepper notes are prominent. Relatively fresh , some woody tones. Good for un-offensive daily wear.

Don't own a bottle myself, but my dad does. I tried it on my wrist and got ~2 hours of moderate projection then it became a skin scent for the remaining 4 hours I could smell it. Nice aventus clone and isn't overly synthetic like people say
Phenomenal smelling fragrance, but longevity is ass get around 30 mins and sillage is bad. Going to start using 20+ sprays now.

Like all Montblanc fragrances, they’re cheap in price and smell mediocre.
Anyone rocking Montblanc scents, especially Explorer and Legend Spirit, is usually the type who uses a 20-in-1 product and thinks that’s peak grooming.

They call this a modernized Creed Aventus type fragrance. It’s boring, definitely doing its own thing, but the drydown does smell somewhat like Aventus.

It opens with a standard, boring citrus top note, and that part disappears almost instantly. What’s left is a strange drydown with hints of licorice and leather, two notes I really don’t enjoy. The result is a weird, unappealing scent.

Now, I normally don’t care about bottles. But this one is the ugliest, most annoying bottle I’ve ever owned. It’s way too heavy for what it is. You can’t see how much is left, and the design is dull and uninspiring.

I really tried to like this, thought it might be a fresh take on Aventus for warm summer days. But it evaporates into nothing within an hour. Honestly, this has some of the worst longevity I’ve ever experienced, right up there with La Nuit de L’Homme.

In the end, I’m genuinely grateful I got rid of it. I’m thankful I don’t wear it, and even more thankful I don’t own it anymore.

I usually perform pretty well from Explorer, with a wear time of around 6 to 8 hours. In terms of scent, it is similar to Aventus but starts to diverge during the dry down. It's extremely affordable on discount sites, making it arguably one of the best fresh fragrances available at this price point. While I believe Dylan Blue might be a better choice for those new to fragrances, Explorer stands out as an overall superior option. It offers incredible versatility, comparable to other blue fragrances like Dylan Blue, Bleu De Chanel, and YSL Y.

Overall: 8.5/10

This is like the perfect gift fragrance. It’s cheap, clean, and safe. It’s not that interesting but it’s perfect at what it’s trying to be. Performance is pretty weak but you can buy full bottles of this for like $30. It might be the goat cheap/gift fragrance.

Montblanc Explorer is one of those safe, versatile scents that just works.

It opens with a fresh, citrusy burst—clean and slightly sharp—then settles into a woody, slightly leathery base that gives it some depth. It’s often compared to Creed Aventus, and while it’s not an exact clone, it definitely gives off similar vibes for a fraction of the price.

Performance is solid for the price point—nothing beastly, but it’ll last you through most of the day with decent projection early on.

If you’re looking for a dependable everyday scent that’s easy to wear, smells great, and won’t break the bank, Explorer is a strong pick. Great for casual wear or even a fancy gathering. Definitely worth checking out.

Montblanc Explorer EDP opens with a pungent, synthetic, chemical pop that smells like a tire garage mixed with salty sweat.

Mont Blanc Explorer is a fragrance that truly impresses with its versatility, making it the perfect choice for daily wear in any season. Right from the first spray, the pink pepper note stands out, adding a vibrant and refreshing twist that captivates the senses. This makes it an excellent option for both casual outings and professional environments, where a refined yet approachable scent is essential.
While Mont Blanc Explorer may not hold the same iconic status as Creed Aventus, it undeniably carves out its own identity within a man's fragrance collection. One of the most compelling aspects of this fragrance is its affordability; you can find a 100 ML bottle for around $45, which is a fantastic value considering the quality it offers.
I would rate Mont Blanc Explorer an impressive 8.8 out of 10. It blends sophistication, versatility, and affordability seamlessly, making it a standout choice for anyone looking to enhance their fragrance wardrobe.

The drydown is very woody and earthy because of patchouli and vetiver with the touch of warm ambroxan. The longevity is 6 hours with 6-7 spray with 1-2 feet of projection for an hour thenafter only arms length projection till the end.

I'm still new to the fragrance world (started in late November 2024) and Explorer was one of the first bottles I purchased after sampling a 5ml decant. I also own CDNIM EDT as well as a decant of Creed Aventus (I will get a big bottle later, down the road). I love this scent profile and DNA of pineapple citrus, smokey, woodiness. And because I'm still new to fragrances, I haven't been burned out by this scent profile like others. I have also learned everyone has different skin, oils and chemistry that interact with different fragrances and what may work well for some will not work as well for others.

With all that said, Explorer does not project as much as CDNIM and that's a good thing to me. I personally get about 5 hours with the last couple of hours being more of a skin scent. By the 7 hour mark, it's pretty much completely faded. Like others have stated, I cannot really smell anything after about an hour. However, I have had people comment on my scent after 2-3 hours. So, I know for me, I had gone noseblind. It is versatile and ideal for me as an office scent, smaller, more intimate gatherings, attending church, or being out and about during the day. I do tend to overspray a little bit more with this fragrance compared to others in my collection. And I can wear it pretty much all-year where I live here in Las Vegas, Nevada. Value for dollar, it's a great choice to me.

This fragrance really shows that you cannot blindly trust reviewers or the community because this is not what I'd expected at all. There's a deep, surprisingly spicy, masculinity to this one, the peppery and woody aspects of this fragrance are very underrated and comes through quite clearly.

Very masculine, not at all a "teenager fragrance" in my opinion.

But get the idea of tutti-frutti bubblegum out of your head because that is not at all what this fragrance is all about.

When i was a kid my family had a membership at a racquet club. Not the exclusive, high end club, but a nice athletic club. The men's locker room was off limits to any under 17, but 12 and up could go in with dad accompanying. The locker room had a guy who handed out the towels when washing your hands (real fluffy white towels!) and for the guys who showered he had a "secret ingredients" aftershave that he would allow the men to spray on. It was an awesome, clean athletic smell. Didn't last very long but I associate that smell with fresh from the shower cleanliness. It is a big memory from my childhood.

Legend Spirit is the closest fragrance I have found to that secret aftershave spray. Smells like fresh from the shower at the club after a hard workout. And that's how i wear it now. 2-3 sprays after the shower at my work gym. Perfect freshie!

This one is very citrusy. Like, aggressively citrusy. First sniff had me thinking of Abercrombie & Fitch Fierce vibes because of that citrus blast, but then it started leaning into Nautica Voyage territory. It’s kind of like if those two did a fusion dance and became one lemony aquatic scent.

For around $25, it’s not a bad cheapie at all. Smells clean, fresh, and like you put in at least some effort. I know Legend Spirit and Nautica Voyage are often compared when it comes to budget summer scents, but personally? I’d go with Voyage. It’s like ten bucks cheaper on Jomashop, a bit softer on the nose, and doesn’t hit you with a toilet cleaner vibe.

And to be fair, Legend Spirit doesn’t totally cross into harsh-cleaner territory, but it’s close. Not in a bad way, just... you’ll know what I mean when you smell it. It’s fresh, but also kind of sharp. Definitely better than smelling like B.O., but not something I’d full bottle. Maybe a good gym bag frag or something you throw on for those really humid days.

Legend Spirit is better from the start simply by being more unique and more versatile. There is a overwhelming sense of freshness that comes across and lingers through the whole profile. Maybe the cardamom? Whatever it is, it helps this fresh, aquatic smell become something almost mouthwatering. And then it gets even better as it dries down and the musk starts to come out. This is one of those summer scents that can be sprayed in the early afternoon and be absolutely perfect, and stays perfect as the day transitions into evening and the scent matures on your skin.

I like it for what it is. A grab and go or dumb reach scent. I have the EDP that I prefer but this one would be the second one I prefer from the ones I have tried from the legend line. They are different profiles, spirit is more youthful summer scent. The edp feels more like a more grown up scent. From spirit I get that sweetness, a bit of citrus not much, then it jumps into that lavender. I got dumont nitro red before this one and they are very similar only difference is the dumont has a melon note and a bit of that amber sweetness. And also the dumont projects more and lasts longer. The spirit presents the aquatic/sea notes on the mid and the spice is noticeable but doesn’t overtake everything. The particular sweetness never leaves it just tones down towards the drydown. At the drydown it gets more woodsy and cleaner, not fresh but clean. Its not a bad scent but it’s a common profile I guess. I don’t have a problem wearing it because it is easy to wear and will work for almost any occasion but preferably during spring and summer, maybe early, early fall depending on where you live. Now we go to performance and it does just ok. Doesn’t project more than an arms length for like 45minutes then it stays close to you for a couple of hours 4-6 before becoming a skin scent. It disappears after 8 hours on my skin. You can adjust it by spraying a bit more; I would recommend at least 6-8 sprays skin and clothing. Pricing on the $30 range for 100ml its not bad. I got the 200ml bottle for $59. Batch is from 02/2024 made in France.

I can KINDA see where the all the people are coming from with all the votes of “reminds me of” Invictus, but to me (thankfully, for me), this isn’t Invictus. I find Invictus much too cloying; I’m not down with the whole “gum-ball sweet” thing. Legend Spirit smells more citrusy from the get go. The middle is where it starts to get slightly like Invictus, but again, the sugary sweetness is not in your face; Legend Spirit turns into what I’d describe as a “light slightly-sporty floral”.
I’m actually a pretty big fan of the original Legend - I find them to be quite different, besides the main lavender note. I’d argue that the og Legend is slightly more versatile, as it is a freshie that I feel can be more easily “dressed up” if needed, while Spirit is airier and more playful; I personally wouldn’t reach for it in a suit. The Spirit does get slightly better performance in my opinion, but that could also just be me being more attuned to certain notes. If you like the og Legend and want to try something a little sweeter and sporty, give it a test, as they are not redundant.

First Pass - Citrus. Very fresh, very clean. Hint of moss

2 Hours Later - Moss. Musk. Unwaveringly clean citrus, and now somewhat dry

4 Hours Later - Drier still. Musk and Moss are stronger. Still quite crisp and clean

Overall - I hated this scent the moment I smelled it. Thankfully, with this hobby I’ve learned to give a 2nd and 3rd look before passing judgement. This scent is aggressive and unusually strong. Legend Spirit (2016) is heavily influenced by Lacoste Blanc 12.12.12 (2011, which I have reviewed separately).

Where Lacoste fails is where Legend Spirit shines. The glaring citrus can be overwhelming, like dozens of fluorescent tubes spotlighting a room. And that is what this smells like, an immaculate, sterilized, bleached-white operating table, or the cleanest bathroom stall you’ll ever visit.

Montblanc adds a touch of moss and musk, which is just enough to balance the bracing citrus. It doesn’t mollify the citrus, I don’t think anything could, but it does add a layer of character that allows us to see something else.

It’s an interesting experience, and one that I think improves on Lacoste’s idea. I expect this scent to be polarizing, and very love/hate. Personally I do enjoy it, sparingly, but only on a very cold, very rainy, day

***Scents, like tastes, are subjective. Wear what you like***

I read a Marie Claire article that pitched the question of what makes a contemporary classic perfume to renowned perfumers, including Cresp. Cresp highlighted that there must be some familiar facet that people get; add to that some pleasing innovation and you're doing well.

To me, the familiar facet is deodorant (and, somehow, Legend OG). I am far too novice to say with authority what the innovation might be in an objective sense, but to me it's largely in the quality of fragrance. Blending, ingredients, other thingsss 👀... when have you ever smelled a deodorant made to the standard of perfume? It feels novel and quite fun.

The initial, intact deo whole spreads out into a juicy aquatic citrus, over creamy white florals and delicate, powdery musk and woods. In dry conditions I find it lands somewhwere dry and powdery, wheras if I'm sweaty the juicy citrus, aquatic and creamy notes stay at the fore.

Thus I feel there are three main contrasting facets that play sequencially: citrus - aquatic > creamy - silky > powdery - woody

That whole package feels new and familiar to me.

Longevity and sillage is really good on my skin, thanks in part to the supersoaker spray nozle (I don't think "atomiser" is apt here).

Suitability: anything where you want to smell fresh and unimposing for all day. It is not sexy, obnoxious or distinctive and would be ideal for someone working in service or healthcare for example. I wore it to a funeral recently because it was not an occassion that was about me at all.

For the gym it's fine, but I prefer something drier. The creaminess with high heat and sweat isn't ideal. Same goes for really hot weather. Not a date fragrance at all.

Deodorant but better. The price point is dead on. I think it's expert, useful, unperfumey perfume. A strong like, an eye-opener and not quite a love for me.

Hope this review helps you.

I personally never cared for this fragrance, I received a half full 3.3oz from my father in a cologne trade off we regularly have done. In my opinion it’s that super duper generic clean, light spicy typical “masculine” smell. It’s so generic/synthetic to me it’s absolutely boring and I would only wear it around the house. I can see some appeal for it and I would not say it smells badly or repulsive. I’d say for someone new to the fragrance world it would be a safe bet for a warm weather mostly crowd pleasing cologne.

I love the opening of this fragrance. It really smells very good. I also like the aquatic and lavender notes a lot. In other words, I love the scent, but although in my opinion it projects well, it only does so for about 30 minutes, and its longevity is poor, very poor.

Would recommend spending the extra couple bucks on YSL Y Eau de Parfum or a similar citrus/lemon fragrance. Doesn't have the same masculine smell that other top citrus fragrances have. Very synthetic, cheap lemon smell.

Overal rating: 5/10
